events.description: Scheduled negotiations between Iran and the US aimed at easing tensions.
Saudi Arabia reduced prices for its main crude grade sold to Asia.
Fresh military strikes targeting Ukraine's energy infrastructure.
Reopening of senior-level military communication between the US and Russia.

facts.fact_text: WTI crude oil futures fell more than 1% to around $62.5 per barrel on Friday.

evidences.evidence_text: WTI crude oil futures fell more than 1% to around $62.5 per barrel on Friday

facts.fact_text: Oil prices are heading for their first weekly decline in six weeks.

evidences.evidence_text: heading for their first weekly decline in six weeks

facts.fact_text: Saudi Arabia cut prices for its main crude grade sold to Asia to the lowest level since late 2020.

evidences.evidence_text: Saudi Arabia cut prices for its main crude grade sold to Asia to the lowest level since late 2020

claims.claim_text: Iran's confirmation of negotiations helped ease near-term concerns over military conflict and supply disruptions.

evidences.evidence_text: Iran’s confirmation that negotiations would take place helped ease near-term concerns over military conflict and supply disruptions

claims.claim_text: The Saudi price cut signals an oversupply in the market.
The smaller-than-expected price reduction by Saudi Arabia suggested confidence in demand.

evidences.evidence_text: the smaller-than-expected reduction suggested confidence in demand

claims.claim_text: Differing views on the scope of Iran-US talks cast doubt on whether major gaps can be bridged.

evidences.evidence_text: differing views on the scope of the talks cast doubt on whether major gaps can be bridged

evidence.evidence_text: helped ease near-term concerns over military conflict and supply disruptions
fresh strikes on Ukraine’s energy infrastructure
